item.title: How do Consumers’ Gender and Rational Thinking Affect the Acceptance of Entertainment Social Robots?
item.description: In this work, we have evaluated how humans’ gender and degrees of analytical thinking impacted their acceptance of a social robot. Specifically, we designed an experiment in which a TIAGo robot was endowed with the ability to provide several degrees of assistance to participants playing a cognitive game.

item.title: Visiting Parc Sanitari Pere Virgili
item.description: A team of researchers from the Perception and Manipulation Laboratory (Institute of Robotics and Industrial Computing) led by Carme Torras visited the Parc Sanitari Pere Virgili intermediate care hospital in Barcelona on October 7th to work on future collaborations in the application of Assistive Robotics within the framework of the PTI+ Neuro-Aging project: Understanding aging from R&D&I.

item.title: AI Eat
item.description: As World’s population is ageing, long-term care for elderly citizens will become an increasing cost for society. To manage these transition healthcare policies are heavily focused on extending the independent life of the elderly, with the dual aim of increasing their quality of life (QoL) and reducing the costs of care.
